org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera

Interface CameraCharacteristics


  • public interface CameraCharacteristics
    THIS INTERFACE IS EXPERIMENTAL. Its form and function may change in whole or in part before being finalized for production use. Caveat emptor. Metadata regarding the configuration of video streams that a camera might produce. Modelled after StreamConfigurationMap, though significantly simplified here.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CameraCharacteristics.CameraMode

    • Method Detail

      • getAndroidFormats

        int[] getAndroidFormats()
        Get the image format output formats in this camera

        All image formats returned by this function will be defined in either ImageFormat or in PixelFormat (and there is no possibility of collision).

        Returns:
        an array of integer format. The formats are as identified by ImageFormat and PixelFormat.
        See Also:
        ImageFormat, PixelFormat

      • getSizes

        Size[] getSizes(int androidFormat)
        Get a list of sizes compatible with the requested image format.

        The format should be a supported format (one of the formats returned by getAndroidFormats()).

        Parameters:
        androidFormat - an image format from ImageFormat or PixelFormat
        Returns:
        an array of supported sizes, or null if the format is not a supported output
        See Also:
        ImageFormat, PixelFormat, getAndroidFormats()

      • getDefaultSize

        Size getDefaultSize(int androidFormat)
        Gets the device-recommended optimum size for the indicated format

      • getMinFrameDuration

        long getMinFrameDuration(int androidFormat,
                         Size size)
        Get the minimum frame duration for the format/size combination (in nanoseconds).

        format should be one of the ones returned by getAndroidFormats().

        size should be one of the ones returned by getSizes(int).

        Parameters:
        androidFormat - an image format from ImageFormat or PixelFormat
        size - an output-compatible size
        Returns:
        a minimum frame duration > 0 in nanoseconds, or 0 if the minimum frame duration is not available.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if format or size was not supported
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if size was null
        See Also:
        ImageFormat, PixelFormat

      • getMaxFramesPerSecond

        int getMaxFramesPerSecond(int androidFormat,
                          Size size)
        Returns the maximum fps rate supported for the given format.
        Returns:
        the maximum fps rate supported for the given format.

      • getAllCameraModes

        java.util.List<CameraCharacteristics.CameraMode> getAllCameraModes()
        Returns all the combinatorial format, size, and fps camera modes supported.
        Returns:
        all the combinatorial format, size, and fps camera modes supported
